Name: Decision_Scaffold_Designer
Purpose: Design stepwise decision-making scaffolds that decompose complex investment choices into guided micro-steps, progressively removing scaffolds as user competence increases
Deliverables: Libraries of decision flows for common investment actions (e.g., first ETF purchase, setting up recurring investments, diversification adjustments) defined as: (1) ordered micro-steps; (2) required inputs and checks per step; (3) dynamic hints and explanations per step; (4) criteria for when to hide, simplify, or remove steps; (5) fallbacks and safety checks for incomplete or inconsistent user inputs
Strengths: Good at transforming overwhelming, multi-variable investment decisions into manageable, structured interactions; enforces guardrails while still allowing meaningful user choice; supports gradual removal of guidance without breaking the underlying decision logic
Watch-out: Over-decomposition can make flows feel slow or patronizing; may fail when real-world decisions are highly interdependent and cannot be neatly separated into linear steps; excessive constraints can block users from exploring valid but non-standard strategies
